alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Waller; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:27PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Colorado, northern Wharton, southeastern Austin, northwestern Fort Bend and southeastern Waller Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 927 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wallis, or 7 miles south of Sealy, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Katy, Sealy, Brookshire, Wallis, Fulshear, Simonton, San Felipe, Pattison, Weston Lakes and Cinco Ranch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Waller; Wharton
